rComments: Thoroughly enjoyed Professor Balot's engaging lectures. His love for classics and political philosophy was evident and proved to be integral to my academic career. I gained the confidence to pursue political philosophy because of Professor Balot.

Overall I enjoyed the class but it was a lot of reading and most of the lectures were just recaps of the readings so they weren't always the most helpful. However, he did provide interesting analysis sometimes on certain topics which was helpful. The final exam was solely essay based so study the readings and take notes in lectures.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Graded by few things']

rComments: Great professor! always gives time to ask questions in lectures and explains everything very clearly, very easy to talk to.

Wonderful professor, sort of quirky and easy to speak with. The only thing I would caution against are some of the TAs he selects to run his tutorials and grade student papers. I had Rachael Desborough... she clearly did not know the material because she made several errors when speaking about some of the philosophers, even confusing some theories.
He's very quiet and has a sense of humour
Uses large words to seemingly show off his intelligence when it just makes lectures hard to follow. Jumps around topics a lot during lectures too.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lots of homework', 'Get ready to read', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: An amazing lecturer who can break down the dense political theory stuff. His lectures were engaging, and he was very knowledgeable. The class itself was very difficult, with heavy readings on lots of weeks. The exam was also difficult. Would not recommend this class (the prof I liked) outside of pre-reqs.

Great prof, but get ready to write a copious amount of (illegible) notes. Lectures are quite stimulating and the prof pauses for questions 3-4 times/lecture. Only reason the lectures are mandatory is the possibility of having a pop quiz.

Balot was an awesome prof! He always tried to make lectures interesting, although if you're not already interested in political theory, you might find the lectures dry. The final was really good because we had the opportunity to practice the questions.
teacherRatingTags: ['So many papers', 'Gives good feedback', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: amazing prof!!! best one i've ever had,by far. Super hot and amazing body!! GREAT GUY!!! Taught me so much and saved my education

This Professor is great. He really made lecture materials and political theory come alive, weaving together all the readings into a unified political narrative. I hated missing a lecture as a result of it being so fascinating. He never failed to engage with the students in lecture (in an effective way) and after class. I definitely recommend him!
Although prof. Balot has standards, they are not so high that they are unattainable. Ask for his advice and he will be more than willing to help you improve your grade (if you are lagging behind).

Talented lecturer with clear, straight forward delivery of his interpretation of the material. Very much expects students to think about the mat'l in a critical way. Engages w/students thoughtfully. Attendance is mandatory for success. Speaks rapidly, recommend use of smart pen or other recording device.

Read, Attend, Read, Participate, Read, Go to his office hours, then read some more...Professor Balot is both friendly, and very helpful...his classes are far from easy, but if you work hard and engage with the text, it can be a very rewarding experience...I take another class with him in a heartbeat...

Prof. Balot is one of the best professors I've had at the University of Toronto. It's a pleasure listening to his eloquently summarized brilliance. He speaks fast but that's because his brain works really fast which is great to have in a professor of political theory.

Great professor who knows the current affairs of political theory analysis and the most important issues in contemporary theories. This is a great addition for those who read their homework, but a drawback if you do not attend class - so go to lectures, takes notes, and talk to him before you write your essays. An easy grade if you try, basically.

Looking for a clear, well delivered set of lectures? This is it. Course direction is clear, his lectures are very organized and he is able to speak at great length, with very little pause (which can be hard at times to keep up!) and is able - and willing -  to pause & interact with students. A great experience.

If you have the option of taking the same class with another prof, take it. He is a great guy, very knowledgeable, but in my experience hard to keep up with. He tries to hard to be what hes not. If you have a class with him be prepared to hear "Ummmmm" a thousand times, he says it after very sentence!

Dr Balot is an amazing guy. he is very versed in his field and has great speaking skills. But the material was extremely hard. overall a great learning experience. People who are not fond of reading excessively through quite monotonous secondary literature on classical philosophy should avoid this course.

Interesting lecturer with a pretty decent sense of humour.  He moves quickly through the the well organized and clear lecture, but you still have to take notes very quickly!!  Overall, he's a pretty good guy with a passion for the subject he is teaching, so ahead and take his class...it's really not that bad.
Good proff. Doesn't really offer any contradicting viewpoints, but is fairly clear and communicates well considering no one in my class asks any questions.

he goes very fast and does not use slides or the board or anything. you must know how to takes effective notes, and quickly. if you do the reading, its easier to follow. if you dont, good luck in lecture.

he goes very fast and does not use slides or the board or anything. you must know how to takes effective notes, and quickly. if you do the reading, its easier to follow. if you dont, good luck in lecture.
